qas.question: What was the policy meant to contain communism in the middle east?
When was the Eisenhower Doctrine adopted?
What leader did the US prop up to foil Nasser?
What country joined an alliance with Egypt, Syria and Saudi Arabia?
Although not communist, what about Nasser concerned pro-western groups?

context: In January <a1_0>1957<a1_0/>, the US adopted the <a0_0>Eisenhower Doctrine<a0_0/> and pledged to prevent the spread of communism and its perceived agents in the Middle East. Although Nasser was an opponent of communism in the region, his promotion of <a4_0>pan-Arabism<a4_0/> was viewed as a threat by pro-Western states in the region. Eisenhower tried to isolate Nasser and reduce his regional influence by attempting to transform <a2_0>King Saud<a2_0/> into a counterweight. Also in January, the elected Jordanian prime minister and Nasser supporter Sulayman al-Nabulsi brought <a3_0>Jordan<a3_0/> into a military pact with Egypt, Syria, and Saudi Arabia.
